title.rendered: The Rates Debate Dividing the Fed

content.rendered: Jerome Powell and some of the more dovish policymakers at the central bank are at odds over how to handle “challenging” inflation and unemployment.

excerpt.rendered: Jerome Powell and some of the more dovish policymakers at the central bank are at odds over how to handle “challenging” inflation and unemployment.

title.rendered: Karen Attiah Says Firing by Washington Post Violated Labor Agreement

content.rendered: The company fired Karen Attiah this month for her social media posts related to Charlie Kirk’s assassination.

excerpt.rendered: The company fired Karen Attiah this month for her social media posts related to Charlie Kirk’s assassination.

title.rendered: Apple Postpones ‘Savant’ Show About Online Hate Groups

content.rendered: Jessica Chastain, the show’s star and one of its producers, criticized the decision on social media on Wednesday.

title.rendered: A Federal Shutdown May Be Imminent. How Would It Affect the Economy?

content.rendered: Congress and the White House have days to fund the government and avert a disruptive and potentially costly lapse in funding.

title.rendered: Germany Woos Indian Workers Spooked by Trump’s H-1B Visa Fee

content.rendered: Selling the prospect of high wages and stable migration rules, Germany’s ambassador to India makes a pitch to skilled Indian workers.

title.rendered: Social Security Workers Struggle to Meet Demand After DOGE Cuts

content.rendered: After this year’s staffing cuts, some people wait for hours, others sail through. But overburdened field office workers carry the weight.

title.rendered: Disney Raises Prices for Streaming Plans in the U.S.

content.rendered: The price hike goes into effect on Oct. 21 and covers the Disney+ service, as well as plans that bundle it with Hulu, ESPN Select and HBO Max.

title.rendered: Why Obamacare Bills May Double Next Year

content.rendered: Extensive subsidies that reduce premium costs for millions are set to expire, unless Congress extends them.

title.rendered: Screwworm Case Detected Less Than 70 Miles from U.S.-Mexico Border

content.rendered: The flesh-eating parasite was detected in northern Mexico. It is the northernmost case of the livestock infection, which was eradicated from the United States in the 1960s.

excerpt.rendered: The flesh-eating parasite was detected in northern Mexico. It is the northernmost case of the livestock infection, which was eradicated from the United States in the 1960s.

title.rendered: Philanthropies Strike a Promising Deal to Turn Back H.I.V.

content.rendered: Low- and middle-income countries will be able to purchase an effective preventative at a reduced price. The arrangements may help stem the epidemic 40 years after it began.

excerpt.rendered: Low- and middle-income countries will be able to purchase an effective preventative at a reduced price. The arrangements may help stem the epidemic 40 years after it began.
